010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012/**
013 * Thresholder as described in N. Otsu, "A threshold selection method from gray-level histograms",
014 * IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics 9(1), 62-66 (1979).
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2022/08/01
018 * 
019 */
020public class OtsuThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
021        
022        private int[] h = null;
023        private double[] M0 = null;             // table of background means
024        private double[] M1 = null;             // table of foreground means
025        private int N = 0;                              // number of image pixels
026        
027        public OtsuThresholder() {
028                super();
029        }
030        
031        @Override
032        public int getThreshold(int[] hist) {
033                h = hist;
034                int K = h.length;
035                makeMeanTables(h);
036
037                double sigma2Bmax = 0;
038                int qMax = -1;
039                int n0 = 0;
040                
041                // examine all possible threshold values q:
042                for (int q = 0; q <= K-2; q++) {
043                        n0 = n0 +  h[q]; 
044                        int n1 = N - n0;
045                        if (n0 > 0 && n1 > 0) {
046                                double meanDiff = M0[q] - M1[q];
047                                double sigma2B =  meanDiff * meanDiff * n0 * n1; // (1/N^2) has been omitted
048                                if (sigma2B > sigma2Bmax) {
049                                        sigma2Bmax = sigma2B;
050                                        qMax = q;
051                                }
052                        }
053                }
054                
055                return qMax;
056        }
057        
058        private void makeMeanTables(int[] h) {
059                int K = h.length;
060                this.M0 = new double[K];
061                this.M1 = new double[K];
062                int n0 = 0;
063                long s0 = 0;
064                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
065                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
066                        s0 = s0 + q * h[q];
067                        M0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? ((double) s0)/n0 : -1;
068                }
069                
070                this.N = n0;
071                
072                int n1 = 0;
073                long s1 = 0;
074                M1[K-1] = 0;
075                for (int q = h.length-2; q >= 0; q--) {
076                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
077                        s1 = s1 + (q+1) * h[q+1];
078                        M1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? ((double) s1)/n1 : -1;
079                }
080                
081//              return N;
082        }
083}
